data.title: Frequently Asked Questions
data.meta_description: Check out World of Coca-Cola FAQ. Find general questions, get info about tickets, tours, events, & see COVID-19 guidelines in these frequently asked questions.
data.text:
At World of Coca‑Cola, you will experience the worldâs most famous beverage in a dynamic, multimedia attraction. Get closer than ever before to the vault that houses the Coca‑Cola secret formula, view hundreds of artifacts, send your taste buds on a trip around the world as you sample beverage, and so much more. Donât miss our newest experience, Beverage Lab, where you can explore the science, creativity and innovation that fuels Coca‑Cola's diverse lineup of drinks.

Parking is available at World of CocaâCola parking garage for a fee starting at $20 per vehicle for all parkers.Â Directions to the garage.

Buses and vehicles larger than 7âH x 8âW x 16âL should utilize the Georgia World Congress Center bus marshaling yard.Â The Georgia World Congress Centerâs marshaling yard offers a large outdoor area for buses and other oversized vehicles. The parking area is secured and offers a lounge for bus drivers.

The lost ticket fee is $25.

Our parking garage is accessible and meets all A.D.A. requirements. You may bring your own wheelchair as World of CocaâCola is ADA compliant and offers ample opportunities for guests to make their way around the attraction. A limited number of courtesy wheelchairs are available on a first-come-first-served basis. Click here for more information.

We welcome and encourage you to take photographs and videos to share with your friends and family. There are also on-site photographers that will capture special moments at designated locations in the attraction. You'll receive your own Postcard and can stop by the Imaging Gallery on the second floor in the Taste it! exhibit to view and purchase your souvenir photos. Special pricing for group photo packages is available.

Proper attire must be worn when visiting World of Coca‑Cola as well as the green space adjacent to the attraction. Since this is a family-friendly attraction, guests should refrain from wearing apparel, accessories, or body art that could be considered offensive or inappropriate. This includes but is not limited to messaging or graphics portraying nudity, profanity, support of drugs or drug use, sexual innuendo/suggestions, negative ethnic or racial commentary, and hatred/violence in any form. Additionally, costumes, costume masks or masks that cover the entire face are not permitted.

World of Coca‑Cola is currently offering Guided Tours. A Guided Tours ticket gets you access to World of Coca Colaâs exhibits, films, and experiences plus an exclusive 1-hour ambassador guided tour through our most popular areas, skip-the-line photo opportunity with the World of Coca Cola Polar Bear, access to unique photo opportunities, and more! Max groups size is 12 guests. You can purchase your tickets here.

Yes, visit World of Coca‑Cola plus four more top Atlanta attractions at a 44% discount with CityPASSÂ®. First, buy CityPASSÂ® online for immediate, paperless mobile ticket delivery. Once you arrive, have your CityPASSÂ® tickets ready to be scanned at the red entry arch. CityPASSÂ® ticket holders do not need an assigned time to visit World of Coca‑Cola. CLICK HERE to learn more about saving 44% on admission using Atlanta CityPASSÂ®.

We require a minimum of 10 tickets for Birthday Groups and 15 tickets for all other Groups.

For Tour operators, group minimums do not apply.

If you need to make a change to the entry time of your ticket, please speak to an associate at the gate. We are able to help with ticket time adjustments pending availability capacity. In the case of a lost ticket, please provide the credit card used to purchase the tickets and your government-issued ID once arriving at the gate so we can help locate your tickets! Tickets to World of Coca‑Cola are nonrefundable.

If you are simply running late, we will do our best to accommodate you once you arrive at the gate. There is no need to contact us ahead of time to let us know you are running late. If you wish to visit at an earlier time, please visit us at the gate and ask for availability to enter earlier. Unfortunately, we are not able to provide refunds or exchanges once your visit date has passed.

We currently offer Guided Tour tickets for $35 per person. The Guided Tour tickets include a 1-hour ambassador-led tour where you will be guided through our most popular exhibits and shows, such as an Olympic torch show-and-tell â all exclusive to the private tour. You will also get a skip-the-line photo opportunity with the Coca‑Cola Polar Bear. Tickets must be purchased online, in advance. Max group size is 12. Groups with less than 12 guests may be paired with other smaller groups.

In compliance with the evolving guidelines from health and government authorities, we have adjusted our policies. The health and safety of our employees and guests remain our top priority.

Face masks are optional for vaccinated guests and ambassadors

Enhanced cleaning routines continue throughout the operation

Physical contact is reduced during transactions

We ask anyone who is not feeling well, or who has a member of their party who is not feeling well for any reason, to visit us at another time so as not to expose our employees and their fellow guests to illness of any kind.

In the spirit of being agile, we will continue to adjust and improve these changes to our operation as needed over time.
